About

Data is everywhere—even in the smallest microbial communities. I harness it to develop computational solutions for challenges in human and environmental health.

Hi, I’m Manjot, a bioinformatics researcher and computational biologist passionate about transforming biological data into meaningful discoveries. From securing NSF grants for high-performance computing research to training transformers for bacterial promoter predictions, I love tackling complex problems.

I spend my free time drawing, mentoring, and experimenting with new coding projects. If you're into data, bioinformatics, or just cool science conversations, let’s connect!

Projects

Time Series Forecasting

Modeling of metastatic human triple-negative breast carcinoma dynamics in murine models.

Bacterial DNA in the Spotlight
